project_metadata.description: A cohesive Domain Model synthesizing bounded context analyses for an e-commerce platform, focusing on customer, inventory, order, and payment management. It defines ubiquitous language, entities, value objects, and domain events across distinct bounded contexts.

bounded_contexts.description: Contains fundamental, universally understood domain concepts (value objects) that are shared across multiple bounded contexts without ambiguity or conflict. These are often primitive concepts with rich behavior.

value_objects.name: Money
value_objects.description: Represents a monetary value with a specific currency, ensuring consistency in financial calculations and preventing precision errors.

bounded_contexts.description: Manages all aspects of customer data, including personal information, contact details, addresses, wishlists, and stored payment method references. Focuses on customer identity and preferences.

entities.name: Customer
entities.description: The central entity representing a user of the platform, holding core personal and contact details, along with associated addresses and stored payment methods. A Customer must have a unique CustomerId and a valid EmailAddress. Can have multiple Addresses and PaymentMethods.

entities.name: Wishlist
entities.description: A curated list of products a customer desires, allowing them to save items for future purchase. Each customer has one wishlist.

entities.name: WishlistItem
entities.description: An individual product entry within a customer's wishlist, referencing a product without storing its full details.

value_objects.name: Address
value_objects.description: A standard physical address used for shipping, billing, or customer residence.

value_objects.name: EmailAddress
value_objects.description: A valid electronic mail address, enforced with validation rules, for customer communication.

value_objects.name: PaymentMethod
value_objects.description: Represents a customer's stored payment method (e.g., credit card last 4 digits, PayPal ID token). Sensitive details are tokenized/encrypted, complying with PCI-DSS standards.

bounded_contexts.description: Manages product catalog information, stock levels, and product categories. Ensures accurate inventory counts and availability for order processing.

entities.name: Product
entities.description: An item available for sale, including its descriptive attributes, pricing, and current stock status. A Product must have a unique ProductId (SKU), Name, and Price.

entities.name: Category
entities.description: A classification group for products, helping with organization and discoverability within the product catalog.

value_objects.name: StockLevel
value_objects.description: Tracks the available, reserved, and reorder threshold quantities for a product, ensuring inventory levels don't fall below zero. Enforces ReservedQuantity for Order processing.

bounded_contexts.description: Handles the complete lifecycle of customer orders, from creation and confirmation to shipping and cancellation. Coordinates with inventory and payment systems to fulfill orders.

entities.name: Order
entities.description: A customer's request to purchase one or more products, encapsulating all details required for fulfillment. An Order must have a unique OrderId, be associated with a CustomerId, and cannot be confirmed until payment is processed.

entities.name: OrderItem
entities.description: A specific product and its quantity within an order. The UnitPrice is immutable for this OrderItem at the time of order placement.

value_objects.name: OrderStatus
value_objects.description: The current state of an order in its lifecycle (e.g., Pending, Confirmed, Shipped, Delivered, Cancelled). Orders transition only through defined states.

bounded_contexts.description: Manages financial transactions, handling payment authorization, capture, and refunds. Ensures compliance with payment industry standards (PCI-DSS) and secure processing of funds.

entities.name: Payment
entities.description: A record of a financial transaction attempt or completion for an order. A Payment must have a unique PaymentId, be linked to an OrderId and CustomerId, and its Amount must be positive.

value_objects.name: PaymentStatus
value_objects.description: The current state of a payment transaction (e.g., Initiated, Authorized, Captured, Failed, Refunded). Payments transition only through defined states.
